rows.title: Body Scan

transcript.eng:
Today's pause is called a body scan. Begin by closing your eyes or maintaining a soft gaze. 
Take a full breath in and a long breath out.
Now, bringing awareness to the top of your body,
your head,
face,
neck,
shoulders.
Noticing any sensations, movements, any places of holding. 
Continue to scan your body, moving down the arms and hands and into your fingers.
Sense the back of your body and your lower back. 
Feeling the contact of your body with the chair if you are seated. 
Now, sensing your upper legs, your lower legs, and the feet. 
Take a full, deep breath in and a long breath out. Finish this pause by opening your eyes. 

Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's lesson.

rows.text_1:
Today's topic is about taking care of yourself 

We often forget to take care of ourselves, but it's really important, especially if you are a parent!

When we lower our stress and treat ourselves kindly, it helps both us and our children.
rows.media_title: How does taking care of myself help me and my family?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

There are times when we experience challenges, face problems, and do not know what to do. It is important to take care of ourselves every day, so we are ready to handle those times well and stay calm. 

When we are calm, we are in a good state to think positively and come up with positive solutions to any challenges we may be facing.

rows.text_1: Let’s look at how @data.characters.f1_mother.name manages to take care of herself when life gets a bit too much.

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “@data.characters.f1_mother.name, come and play with me with my dolls!” 

 @data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “I am feeling so stressed. Let me take a deep breath... Phewww… Maybe I can finish cooking and then take a few minutes to play with @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. It will take my mind off all these worries.”

@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “Allright, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, let me finish dinner quickly, and then I will come play with you.” 

 @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Okay, @data.characters.f1_mother.name.”
@data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “I am glad I took some time with my child. I feel a bit better and my mind feels clearer already. After dinner, I deserve a cup of tea by myself.”

@data.characters.f1_mother.name  *(thinking)*: “What a day. I have a lot on my plate, but I am still standing and trying my best every day. Tomorrow, I should visit with my friends so we can catch up and be reminded that we aren't alone!"

rows.section_1_text: Taking a pause helps us to feel and respond calmer in stressful moments.
rows.section_1_extra_text:
Even taking a few deep breaths makes a big difference. 

By staying calm instead of reacting strongly, you can also prevent a lot of problems!
rows.section_2_text: Take a moment and think of one thing YOU did well recently. Say it aloud if you can: "Well done for …"
rows.section_2_extra_text:
Being a parent can be hard. Praise yourself for trying your best. 

Identify negative thoughts when they start and decide if they are true or helpful. If not, find positive thoughts to replace them with. 

For example, instead of “I am a bad parent” say “I am feeling overwhelmed right now, but I am doing the best I can and I will talk to a friend for support”.
rows.section_3_text: What makes you happy? Find small things that you can do every day to care for yourself.
rows.section_3_extra_text: Doing something you enjoy will give you a short break. It will help you to think more clearly and care better for your family. Caring for yourself = caring your family!

rows.media_title: How it helped a parent like you:
rows.media_transcript:
For me as a parent, it was almost impossible to find time for myself. I was always busy taking care of everyone else. Through @global.app_name, I realised how important it is to take care of myself. It helps me AND my family! 

Having a moment for myself helps me to breathe and notice how I feel. Even five minutes to have a cup of tea makes a big difference. Now I can deal with my stress better.
